str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Late, evening. From opse; late; feminine afternoon or nightfall.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A vineyard. From ampelos; a vineyard.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From epi and tropos; a commissioner, i.e. Domestic manager, guardian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A field-laborer; then: a laborer, workman in general. From ergon; a toiler; figuratively, a teacher.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
